intro: Microstylis brachypoda, commonly known as the short-styled rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and swamps. The plant has slender, grass-like stems with small, clustered spikelets that contain both male and female flowers. Its roots are fibrous and help stabilize the soil in wetland habitats. Microstylis brachypoda plays an important ecological role in maintaining the health of wetland ecosystems.
